page.title: 12Chatteris - Fens Land Use
page.content:
Since the begininning of the century Nightlayer's Fen has been arable land. Birch Fen was used as pasture land for cattle. In the middle of the fen was an old oak tree, only the stump remains. A private housing estate was built there during the 1960's. The Chatteris Urban District Council rubbish dump was at Campole Hill, south of Dean Hill. Fenland District Council closed it down as it was infested with rats.
Langwood Fen was owned by one farmer, it produced potatoes, carrots, sugarbeet, cereals and mangles. Eel Piece Pond and Langwood Hill Drove were reached by footpaths from Wenny Road and New Road. It was a popular place to walk to from Chatteris.
